description: Source code for a test module that verifies the functionality of the 'universalinit' project templates, specifically focusing on an Express.js template. It includes test fixtures, setup functions, and test cases for project initialization, configuration loading, and template rendering.

classes.name: ProjectConfig
classes.description: Configuration class for project parameters such as name, version, description, author, project type, output path, and additional parameters.

classes.name: ProjectType
classes.description: Enumeration of supported project types, e.g., EXPRESS.

classes.name: TemplateInitInfo
classes.description: Holds initialization information for templates, including commands for environment configuration, building, running, and generating OpenAPI specs.

classes.name: TemplateProvider
classes.description: Provides templates based on project type and template directory.

classes.name: ExpressTemplate
classes.description: Template class for Express.js projects, supports extracting init info and rendering templates.

methods.name: test_express_init_info(template_dir, project_config)
methods.description: Verifies that the template's initialization info is correctly retrieved, including commands for environment setup and OpenAPI generation.

methods.name: test_project_initialization(template_dir, project_config)
methods.description: Tests the project setup process, ensuring the output directory structure and contents are correctly generated with the appropriate content.

methods.name: test_post_processing_execution(template_dir, project_config, temp_dir)
methods.description: Validates that post-processing scripts are executed during project setup.

methods.name: test_config_file_loading(temp_dir)
methods.description: Checks that project configuration can be loaded from a JSON file correctly.

methods.name: test_template_variable_replacement(template_dir, project_config)
methods.description: Ensures that template placeholders in files are correctly replaced with project configuration values during initialization.
